SENT.plain: Two cases of Burkitt's tumor treated in the Pediatric Hospital, Owendo, Libreville are discussed
The tumors were of the maxillofacial type, and remission by chemotherapy was obtained for a period of between 6 to 8 months
After this length of time, and in spite of spectacular local results, metastases developed and led to a fatal outcome
Cyclophosphamide chemotherapy is effective locally, but does not prevent recurrence
